topics.title: Euler Angles and Conventions
topics.description: The speaker explains the concept of Euler angles, specifically mentioning the ZXY convention for representing rotations in a quadrotor's movements.
evidence_quotes: We will use the ZXY convention, the first rotation being about the Z-axis through Psi,

topics.title: External Forces and Moments
topics.description: The speaker introduces external forces (thrusts) and moments that act on a quadrotor, explaining how these can be combined to predict the robot's acceleration.
evidence_quotes: We have four thrusts, F1, F2, and F3, and F4, and then four moments, M1, M2, and M3, and M4.

topics.title: Quadrotor Dynamics
topics.description: The speaker begins discussing the dynamics of a quadrotor, introducing the concept of two coordinate systems (body fixed and inertial) and explaining how they relate to the robot's movements.
evidence_quotes: Once again, let's remind ourselves that we have two coordinate systems,
